subject: Sales
title: The Paradox of Choice
description: A tiny lesson with a big payoff: The Paradox of Choice.

hook.text: A jam display with 24 flavors drew crowds. A display with 6 flavors sold ten times more actual jam.

buildup.text: Schwartz's paradox of choice: more options create more anxiety and ultimately fewer purchases.

discovery.text: Overwhelmed with options, buyers freeze. The easiest decision becomes buying nothing at all.

twist.text: Luxury brands grasp this. Fewer models, curated menus, and limited editions boost conversion rates.

climax.text: Offer three options at most. Guide the buyer to the best fit. Simplicity drives real decisions.

punchline.text: Fewer choices lead to more decisions.

quiz.question: What did the jam experiment prove?
options: Too many choices paralyze buyers and reduce sales
